com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.servlet

Class ThemeServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.servlet.ThemeServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    Deprecated. 
    no longer required. Theme is now available via WServlet.The bordertech.wcomponents.theme.content.path parameter im wcomponents-app.properties must not be set and there must be servlet-mappings to the url-patterns "/{my-mapping}" and "/{my-mapping}/*" where you specify the value of {my-mapping}.

    @Deprecated
public class ThemeServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet

    This servlet is designed to serve up theme files from within the WComponent project or jar file. This saves developers from having to configure where the webdocs directory is, or extract the theme into their WAR file.

    The ThemeServlet expects all static resources to be available in the classpath under /theme/XXXXXX/. Where "XXXXX" is the value of the configuration parameter "theme.name".

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Yiannis Paschalidis
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        protected void doGet(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
              throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                     IOException
        Deprecated. 
        Serves up a file from the theme.
        Overrides:
        doGet in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Parameters:
        req - the request with the file name in parameter "f", or following the servlet path.
        resp - the response to write to.
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - on error.
        IOException - if there is an error reading the file / writing the response.
